page.title: 17 Micro Cars
page.content: A sign of the recent concern over the rising cost of petrol and private cars is the recent development of a small factory in Dunkirk making a micro-vehicle.The building used to be a filling station but the new by-pass took trade away.The small vehicles are easy to drive,economic to run and can be driven by 16 year olds and over.The Company was named the 'Moped Cursor Cars Company'.The cars would sell at about 1700 pounds.Mind you, the cars have no roof,no doors,a windscreen,a window at the back and only three wheels - 2 at the front and 1 at the back.They do not have a reverse gear,so the owner has to push his vehicle back- wards if necessary!A motor bike engiine is fitted.The Sinclair C5,the world's first mass produced battery powered car,has been a recent commercial failure.But 1 has been seen hereabouts.
